intro: Heterotis cinerascens, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is characterized by its large, pale purple flowers that open at night, making it a nocturnal bloom. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces small, round fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in swampy areas. Botanically, it belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus.
